newsitem.title: USA: Lawfirm says files suit against WebSecure.
newsitem.headline: Lawfirm says files suit against WebSecure.

text.p: A lawfirm representing purchasers of Websecure Inc common stock said on Thursday that the shareholders had filed a lawsuit against the company alleging it submitted false and misleading information regarding its initial public offering.
Kaufman Malchman Kirby & Squire LLP, one of two firms representing the stockholders, said the suit had been filed in the U.S. District Court in Massachusetts.

The complaint charges that Websecure and some of its officers and directors filed a registration statement that omitted material facts concerning software technology acquired by Websecure, the company's revenues and its relationship to Centennial Technologies Inc, named as a related party.
On April 22, Websecure said it had been named in three lawsuits, also alleging that its initial public offering filing contained false information.
No one was available for comment at the company.
Websecure offers access and support services for commercial transactions and communications over the Internet.
